captions.text: Hey, I'm Kevin from Vsauce2 and you may not know it but you're producing and secreting air born chemicals and smells that signals about you.
Research points to the idea that body odor and maybe pheromones play a large role in attraction.
People are often attracted to the smell of someone with different genetic makeup. Different make up makes healthy offspring.
And studies indicate body order could even help signal sexual orientation.
So B.O. could actually be your smelly wingman helping you to find the perfect mate.
We had couples sleep in the same shirt for 4 nights removing perfumes and deodorants...
And then asked if they could pick out their partner's smell from the other contestants, and if that smell was attractive to them.
So let's check out this sort of scientific smell and attraction test.
Alright we're gonna start with number three.  This is definitely not you. This is my third grade girlfriend.
How do you clear your nose palate? This is like smoky 100 year old Scotch which smells great.   Girl: I wanna be her friend.
This could be a contender. girl: How come? Cuz it smells perfect.  girl: Number 8, I could be around you. Number 8 is  you.
He has a horrible sense of smell so I think this might be a disaster.  Let's do this. Fresher than I imagined it would smell.
Like someone soaked this one in candlewax. Something a little pine. A little evergreen. Smells way too sweet to be you.
You don't smell like cotton candy.  What?! Wait really.
I actually feel more confident now. This one has a little BO. This one doesn't smell very much. Yeah someone is hygenic. I was confident, now I'm not so confident. I could be wrong but
I'm going to go with 9. Yeah.  Oh nooo!
So odor DID play a role in this smell and attraction test. When it comes to love, maybe your nose knows best.

title: Couples Try To Recognize Each Other's Smell

comments.author: Ravyn Skye

comments.text:
+mai0mai - I lived in Japan 10 years, too... Trying to find REAL deodorant 
there was almost impossible.  I'm not saying that Asians have NO smell at 
all (his sweat is saltier than mine, for instance, but salt actually kills 
bacteria, and bacteria mixed with sweat is what causes body odor, so more 
salt in sweat means less smell), but they have nowhere near the level of 
body odor that white people do, in general... When was the last time you 
had to wear deodorant because you knew if you didn't, within the day, you'd 
smell to the point others would notice it?
